Asu no Yoichi a.k.a Samurai Harem is an ecchi harem martial arts comedy series that isn't great but it is kind of entertaining. I may not be a big fan of harem series but I don't mind ecchi if it's not over the top. Despite being having harem right in the title, you don't really get an actual sense of a harem forming in this series. The main character Yoichi Karasuma is in fact surrounded by girls but only two actually make an attempt at vying for his affection while the others are typically there to suffer at the hands of his "ecchi accidents." DespiteYoichi being the main character, he isn't really an important person but the fact that he has Ibuki's attention gives him some worth in this series. Really Ibuki, the oldest of the Ikaruga sisters is the most important character in Asu no Yoichi as the MC's rival and the antagonist are in love with her and the development of her sisters revolve around her in some way. Eventually you begin to feel that Yoichi is really nothing but an obstacle put in place for cock-blocked related comedy and ecchi scenes.



The most interesting character development in Asu no Yoichi will be Ayame attempting move from under her  older sister, Ibuki's shadow. Everything else is pretty much fanservice in some way shape or form with the comedy being kind of bland and the action scenes being interrupted by nosebleeds. The one thing that doesn't mean anything to the plot but it really stands out is the strange shrinking of Torigaya which is never explained and becomes even more strange in the last episode. Speaking of which, the last episode was horrible. I really wanted an answer for Torigaya's weird shrinking but oh well. In the end, there isn't really anything special or note worthy about Asu no Yoichi but I guess if you're looking for an ecchi martial arts series with a poor attempt at a construction of harem, you might want to check this series out...


GLHF.. :)

I thought it was going to be something like Rurouni Kenshin, in the sense that the MC travels and encounters lots of opponets. But Asu no yoichi doesn't have much story, and doesn't have much martial arts either. it's more slice of life, day by day events, and that was disappointing.
The characters use the same attacks over and over again and none of them become stronger, because they're all invincible. non of the enemies is a real threat. 
That the anime focuses more on the moral values and the characters vision of justice.
All of the female characters have a fixated personality and act according toit, therefore you can predict how the will act upon a certain situation, what the'll say or do. 

It gets repetitive arround episode 5, because nobody does anything different that you haven't watched several times already.


Every episode is the same cliché joke over and over again from each girl.

Some bad things simply "happen" for the sake of the characters having something to fight against, this is incoherent and senseless.


This anime coul'd have been a solid 8-9 if the jokes weren't the same every episode, if the characters didn't do the same things over and over again.

It never grows much from the first few episodes. And it gets borring half way through.

I when i started it felt like a 9, but at the end it was a 6 more close to 5.


This is a pretty bad harem and a bad martial arts anime, that starts greatly and then goes downhill.


Non the less, It will definitely give you some laughs. I recommend watching it because despite these errors, it's entertaining and has some moments that are funny. It's not a must watch, and it wont be on your top favourites, but If you are curious just give it a try. Everyone will  find something to enjoy.

Asu no Yoichi is a harm ecchi anime, like so many out there today.  The story line wasn't that great, but it was better than some other harem ecchi anime. Asu no Yoichi is an anime that embodies the harem genre in so many ways. The art and sound are done well while so much lacks in the series for the sake of just selling a few fanservice scenes.
Story - 6
It starts off with a decent premise. Teen guy has lived and trained in the mountains his entire life as a samurai. He goes to the city to continue his training and stays with a family of 4 girls. While it is sort of a harem, there are only 2 real love interests and there was pretty much zero romantic development in the series. Theoverarching plot was started earlier on than in many ecchi/harem shows, even of this length, but they left any real development until very late and in the end just failed to change anything from the first episode. The ending was disappointing. Really disappointing. Many anime choose to go with an open end, but few do it this badly.


Art - 9

No complaints here. I liked most of the art. They clearly put more effort into the art than in the story. I liked most of the character designs, though some of the backgrounds were a bit bland.


Sound - 9

I enjoyed the voice acting and the OP and ED. I thought they all did very well. It isn't their fault some of the lines they had to read were laughably bad and most of the voices matched their characters well.


Character - 6

This one is tough for me. I liked most of the characters. Yoichi and the sisters are all good characters, if a bit cliched. I really dislike many harem leads, but I liked Yoichi even if he was a bit bland and Ibuki was fine, even though they developed her character much less than almost everyone else in the show. Wa-san and his friend, Tsubame and Angela, and some of the other characters were all interesting enough. But there is zero development. One girl is the clear lead from the first episode, but most of the episodes concentrate their energy on other characters. Even with that, there is little to no development in their characters either. Add in one of the more loathsome antagonists and I just can't give the characters too high a score.


Enjoyment - 5

Up until the last few episodes I may have given this a 7 or higher. I enjoy romances. And I enjoy ecchi comedies. This show has its moments. Most of them were pretty early on. But eventually, one would expect there to be some development. And when there isn't any by the 7-8 episode mark, I have to start to worry about the direction of the show. They kept doing the same jokes over and over again, so after the first few episodes, it started to lose its comedic edge as well. When they started the plot movement in the last few episodes, I was glad that something was finally going to happen. But then they just reverted everything back to the way it was. Absolutely nothing came from it other than introducing the world to an asshole. No romantic development, even with the somewhat complicated web of characters. No feeling of satisfaction from a concluded plot. And no real ending. I guess the last few moments of the show are just about right. Was that perhaps the script he was blowing his nose on?


Overall, I have to give the show a 6. The art and sound were good and the idea of the show was not too bad. A naive kid coming to the city should make for some interesting moments, and it does, but the flaws of the show are just too big to ignore. I would say it is probably worth a watch for most anime aficionados, but many will be bored with it quickly. Luckily, or unluckily, depending on how you look at it, there are only 12 episodes. Perhaps there would be more development with more episodes, but at least it wont cost you too much time if you don't enjoy it.

Overall	
A very uninspired love polygon/harem anime, with stuff snatched from all over the place. Concepts from mainly Love Hina, FMP, School rumble and Kenshin are obvious and despite borrowing from good sources, the end result is simply not good in any way.
Animation	
Stiff animation and very standard graphics. Often, this is enough if the characters are well designed, but sadly they are not. They really tried to make the characters looks unique and cool, but they just look grey and unpersonal. Except for Ayame, who looks great and would have deserved starring a better anime than this.
The fighting scenes are not really much about fighting, butrather still poses and a lot of wind blowing about.


Sound	

Opening and ending themes are allright, and so is voice acting. Except for Ayame, whose voice doesn't really suit her.


Story	

As usual in a harem, it is qiute easy to predict the outcome. Actually, the story gets a bit more complex with each episode, as new characters are introduced, which is a good thing. 


I never really got emotionally involved in the story or the characters, so I never appreciated the most of humour either. The "Washizu views" and the "raven" ninja guy were fun, though.


Character	

Welcome to Big brother: Anime stars. Starring

Himura Kenshin

The lovechild of Narusegawa and Kaoru

Harima Kenji

Er... and some other people (including a couple of surfing ninjas) 


...and they ALL have giant boobies. Yes, even the ten year old.


Most of the characters are shallow and flat (not talking about tits here) and don't evolve much. The most interesting are the bad guys and Ayame. 


Yoichi is one of one of the most boring main characters I have ever seen; he can't be beaten in combat, he is always polite and the comedy potential of his unawareness of society never really takes off.

For those who like to skim:
If you enjoy the harem genre, a bit of light action and comic relief to spice things up occasionally and are running out of things to watch Asu no Yoichi is definitely fun enough to merit a viewing.
For the rest:
Plot-wise Asu no Yoichi is rather simple, though not so thin as to be unsatisfying: a young samurai, Karasuma Yoichi, descends from the mountains, where he has spent his entire life training, to join a dojo in the city, which is of course maintained by 4 sisters living without parental supervision.
Even without the main antagonist of the story the interplay betweencharacters as Yoichi adjusts to his new life is enough to make the series enjoyable. A mess of tangled back and forth unrequited love mean that comedy is never far away, often delivered in very well executed and hilariously drawn daydreams.\n\n
I found the romance aspect to be a bit lacking. Many crushes and few meaningful confessions with tangible outcomes left me feeling that the characters could have developed deeper, more complex relationships than they did.\n\n
Overall, I found Asu no Yoichi to be a rather average anime. A few good artistic ideas and what I found to be genuinely funny comedy proved to be just enough to balance the uncomplicated plot and standard characters. I enjoyed each episode, but feel that the series overall difficult to describe without using the words 'average', ' standard' or 'OK'.

Amazing story for a simple and easy going anime, the kind of anime you want to sit back relax and finish. I found myself drawn to it after the first episode. You know very well that a strong male lead and harem always mixes nicely. 
I don't really have much to say about the art.... I really don't know if I like it or hate it... ..bottom line the art is pretty normal but that's only my opinion. 
As for the sound I taught it was really captivating, it really brought the scenes to life. I loved it. 
The characters were nice, lovable,  cute....Even had a tsundere character. And what good is a harem anime without a tsundere character. \n

A fairly typical 12-and-done ecchi harem anime with great art and a good concept. The plot and character development in the first half are excellent; however, the second half is plagued with an unrealistic antagonist and a rushed finale that fails to resolve the important questions.
Strengths:
- great animation
- relatable, likable characters. You really want them ALL to be happy.
- funny
- overpowered MC
- not the typical harem plot (NOT all girls inevitably fall for the MC)
Weaknesses:
- only 12 episodes; rush job finale
- antagonist in the second half is ridiculous
- harem plot that gets sidetracked and never really resolves
The plot was pretty good for a 12 episodeharem anime. I was impressed with the attention given to the MALE minor characters, which are usually brushed over. Some of the girls even fall for other guys besides the MC - so be warned, there may be some NTR. Overall, the concept and characters had great potential, but the show never really climaxed because the antagonist was so bad and wasted so much screen time.\n\n
The main character is endearingly oblivious, and satisfyingly overpowered. Like most of the characters in the show, he has a good heart and tries to help others, but often makes mistakes.  In that respect, he is very similar to the main characters from Full Metal Panic/Fumoffu and Rurouni Kenshin. The other characters are generally well done, too, especially one of the male minor characters, Washizu, who is both round and dynamic. On a somewhat related note, I suspect that one of the characters doesn't really exist, which is interesting, to say the least (take that with a grain of salt, though - it's 3:30 AM and I just binge-watched 12 episodes of an ecchi harem anime).\n\n
Overall, it gives you everything you expect from this type of anime, and more. I recommend it if you liked at least 2 of the following: Demon King Daimou, Rakudai Kishi no Cavalry, Full Metal Panic/Fumoffu, Air Gear and Rosario+Vampire.

Hey folks, this will be a review for Asu no Yoichi. I have a fair amount of negative things to say about this anime. As someone who loves this genre its generally hard to find one that I dislike to this extent. Lets get into it.
The story is somewhat interesting and has a premise which could have been used to create an entertaining anime. A boy who lives in the mountains and trains in his family's special sword skill is sent to live in the city with people his father knew under the pretense of training further. The first couple of episodes played this outreally well. We were introduced to our main character Karasuma, Yoichi, and got to join him as he made his way through the city the first time. Needless to say he runs into trouble almost immediately and gives the false impression of more fun to come.


After these first few episodes we are thrown into random encounters. The show has a slice of life feel with terrible scenario writing. Each sister has an event which makes them either come to like or respect Yoichi. However these events are terribly written, or should I say poorly written and hindered by the lackluster characters. After the sister events Yoichi and his sword style are targeted by an unknown person for unknown reasons. This remains true until the last two episodes which are so lame it was all I could do to not drop it. Unfortunately I cant go further into detail without spoilers but, it really felt like the writers felt bored wrote something then tried to patch it together into a coherent story later.


The art and sound were just ok. I liked the art style but it is dated. Soundtrack was very forgettable.


The characters were the straw that broke this harems back. As eluded our male MC is an uncultured samurai. After reading the synopsis and watching the first episode I had thought it would be similar to FMP. Unfortunately the writing kicks in here and they just turn him into one of those super unlucky characters surrounded by violent women. He constantly is getting his butt kicked by the sisters for various things that are either stupidly childish like the "oops, I grabbed your boobs even though nothing was going on but it felt like the correct time to add in a laugh", or various other situations that he actually wasn't responsible for.


The four sisters Ikaruga, Ayame, Ikaruga, Chihaya, Ikaruga, Ibuki, Ikaruga, Kagome were amazingly shallow(as was all the other characters). Ayame was the super tsundere who after being a cunt for the first couple episodes decided to cook for the sick Yoichi, who even in his sickened state managed to do impressive acrobatics and win her heart with kind words. She goes on to not do anything to progress her love for Yoichi and interrupts the action with jealousy at every turn. Chihaya is a manga artist and loves to tease Yoichi and get him into trouble. She actually had a decent enough story behind her interest in him but felt rushed. She basically only makes a few appearances and really isn't important. Ibuki the main female character is violent and falls for Yoichi because of his swordsman skills. Kagome was supposed to be the grounding stone in this family as a cute young semi mature sister. However she only plays small parts in aiding either a story event or helping a sister do something.


The other characters are barely worth mentioning. Throughout the show they introduce more characters but they all are basically cheesy villains that are used and tossed aside. There is a massive love tangle in this show. Almost everybody likes Ibuki and this becomes the driving factor later in the show. This introduces your typical blonde haired delinquent and your rich prince like character.


I was so disappointed in this anime. I didn't expect it to be amazing but at least average for a harem. The beginning was a good hook and made me interested in the rest of the show. However it quickly becomes repetitive, cringy and even frustrating. The ending was pretty bad and really drags this shows score from mediocre to bad. The girls weren't that cute, main character didn't feel like he had a personality and wasn't really interesting to watch. Not really  a bad thing but I should also mention calling this show ecchi is a major overstatement. There are only two moments in the entire show which was eye catchingly sexual in but the rest was like shoulder level cleavage and the occasional ripped shirt to show an undershirt. Overall this one should be avoided, even by those of you who enjoy this genre. This isn't very well detailed because this show is so bland that even the smallest detail would probably save you a few episodes.


TLDR: Not good, poor writing, bad characters, no echhi. Even harem enthusiasts like myself shouldn't watch.

Asu No Yoichi is mainly focused on Yoichi Karasuma. A samurai who was sent to the Ikaruga Dojo/The City by his father to become a stronger warrior/experience other things that he hasn't done while living in the mountains. When he arrives at the City, he starts out as a total outcast. Causing mischief (Though he means well.), wearing strangle clothing, and even saying strange things. But as the story progresses, he slowly begins to learn the city life and eventually enjoys it. He also manages to get a few girls to fall in love with him. 
Story : 7/10
The story is basically a romantic comedywith action. it isn't really much of a harem. The plot of the story isn't necessarily anything too extraordinary. But it does contains lots of fighting scenes and some romantic scenes.


Art : 9/10

Oh MAN. Another thing that caught my attention and probably a lot of other peoples' attention was the artwork of the picture on the anime's page. THE CHARACTERS LOOK AMAZING. The females are beautiful and i have to admit, Yoichi is a pretty handsome samurai.


Sound : 9/10

Voice acting and sound effects for the scenes were superb. 


Character : 7/10

There isn't any major development in characters, but you will see some development as the story progresses. 


Enjoyment : 8/10

It's a fun anime to watch, the funny scenes and ecchiness kept it going along with the action.


Overall : 8/10

Overall Asu no Yoichi contains : A Decent story, good sound and visuals, and mild character development.

Anyone who is interested in watching a romantic comedy with action and a small harem should definitely check Asu no Yoichi out.

The reason I really liked this anime was for the great moral aspects it puts forth. I actually started the series by reading the manga and I must confess that at first a big reason was the "fan service" it included (I apoligize). However, after reading/watching it for awhile I came to absolutely love it! If an anime has fighting and a good story then thats great, but I firmly believe that the most important part of a story of any kind is the values contained within. The characters are all very kind with a great sense of responsibility and spirit. However, the biggest reasonI watch/read this series is because of the main character: Kurasama Yoichi. No matter what he is diong, whether fighting, studying, or just talking to his friends, he is always amazingly kind and puts the needs and wants of others first before his own. I believe that this servant-like attitude is what's really important in a story and in life itself. His pure character is enough of a reason for me to continue reading and watching the series.

It is nice to come across a fun and just enjoyable to watch martial arts themed comedy anime. The story line was predictable but fun. The fan service was humorous but not overdone. The characters were diverse and interesting for the most part. So if you like martial arts, shounen, harem and some good laughs you should like Asu no Yoichi!

Overall a decent sized anime, it had elements unique to it, while most of it ranged from what we've already seen. The name is an obvious hint to what the story is about, and it can also be misleading. It does present a lot of "love triangles" and unlike the manga (obviously) it leaves a few plot holes. Overall gets a 7 from me. (not that I didn't like it.)
The story a 7- cause while it does resemble a lot of harem, multi-girl to one guy anime, it is entertaining. The anime could have been extended to make the ending less choppy and more- smoothlydraw out, but it does leave room for a sequel and for the pairings hinted on to either be fulfilled or played with more.\n
The art and sound also get strong 7's- they were all colorful characters- made me think of candy actually.The fight scenes with the martial art effects was good and while not a whole lot of serious detail the series manages to pull it off. The opening and ending titles- both happy, energetic,and the since this anime had a lot of girl voices-they were all so adorable. And it will make you laugh and think that this situation really could have turned out better.\n
The characters get a 7. But I will give credit-the fact that one of the characters was a manga artist was a nice touch. And that the series has a lot of silliness that you don't really have to look too hard to see. The characters individually are drawn out to where they aren't really shallow- but could be developed better. Certain relationships could be worked on- while the creators did make it seem like they weren't absolute. \n
Overall it's a decent (respectfully) series to just sit back and chill and watch. To get away from the main stream, laugh, and compare.
